characters: I'M GONNA GO GET HELP. I'M GONNA
SOMEBODY GET US DOWN FROM HERE
WHAT THE FUCK DO I DO
NOTHING. I'M GONNA GO FOR IT, OK
COME ON, I PAID GOOD MONEY TO DO
OK, WHAT ASSHOLE COULDN'T GET ON
DON'T YOU FUCKING LET HER LOOK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peace. Fresh snow glistens in the sunlight and reflects off of t giant pine trees covering the serene mountain side. It's quiet. So quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tight on a gloved hand as a lever is released. Tight on the cables at the top of a rickety chair lift as they kick into motion. Wider as an empty chair swivels around and beneath the as of a threesome of SKIERS. Even wider to reveal a long line of Skiers and SNOWBOARDE awaiting their moment to step up to the chair. The camera finds a group of three standing off to the sid the line, decked out in their winter gear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angle on DAN WALKER (college age, shaggy hair, holding a snowboard and a helmet in one hand) as he studies the situation. Next to him stands an impatient JOE LYNCH (college age, goggles on his head and a face full of fres stubble, standing on skis).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't see her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shift change is late.   Just wait. PARKER O'NEIL (college age, red hair, holding a snowboard sighs and stares back at the lift lane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure about this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been doing this forever. Trust me. This lady loves Lynch. She always goes for it. Lynch smiles at Parker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm cute. Just then, JASON (a ski mountain employee) approaches the front of the line and excuses the employee working the ch

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is um... is that her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's cool, it's cool. (to Parker) Look, all you have to do is smile real pretty and tell him-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -What?   Me? No way.    This is your thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker, listen, listen. It's so easy. All you do is tell the guy that you and your friends-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -GIRLfriends. Say "girlfriends".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -you and your girlfriends forgot your credit card and you can't pick up your lift tickets. He grabs a wad of cash out of Lynch's glove and shoves it Parker's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Start at $50. That's what we usually give the other lady. He'll take it. Trust me. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan, no.   You do it.    I feel stupid. DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got this.    You can totally do this. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker, you've so got this. DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The worst thing that happens is he says no. He won't say no. No one ever says no. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why me? LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Cause you're a girl. DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A very beautiful girl with a very charming smile. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just... He unzips her jacket a little bit, showing some more of h body. DAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My charming smile? Dan and Lynch smile back at her.    She exits reluctantly towards the lift line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker pushes her snowboard forward and moves up the side the line, passing all of the skiers who are waiting. She approaches Jason who is now running the lift.    He l a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Jason looks up at her. PARKER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could I bum a smoke? She flashes an adorable but forced smile and he quickly obliges with a cigarette. PARKER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. He lights her cigarette. PARKER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Parker. He looks around, not all that sure why a cute girl is tal to him for more than just to get a smoke. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, cool.    My brother's name is Jason. JASON

dialogues.speaker: OK.
dialogues.text: PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, so I don't want to waste your time and bullshit you cause you seem like a wicked busy guy and everything...but..this is gonna sound so stupid... Jason is all ears. PARKER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My girlfriends and I drove all the way up here from Salem State, and I was sort of the dumbass who told everyone that I could cover the lift tickets on my Mom's credit card...but then I left her credit card at the gas station...and so... Jason totally sees where this is going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No- but I mean, we totally have some cash and stuff. We just don't have enough to cover all 3 lift tickets, you know? Jason exhales two lungs full of smoke as the next group g onto the lift. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much? PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like...fifty? Jason scoffs and starts the lift. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could lose my job. He looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynch and Dan watch Parker at work. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not going for it. DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you shut up? He's gonna go for it. It's either stand there and do the job for minimal... minimal, what is it? LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Minimum. DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -Minimum wage or do it for minimum wage plus a little bit more. Lynch sighs, then changes the subject. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She had to come skiing with us? Dan looks back at him, offended.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said you didn't mind? LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't.   I don't mind.   Don't mind at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat. LYNCH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just saying, you haven't done dollar pitchers at Fezziwigs with

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: us since last semester. You never come around for Monday night football, nobody has seen you at- DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -I watched the game with you last week! LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For ten minutes, Dan. Football games are more than ten minutes. M

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're lots of ten minutes-es, you know? DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, I have a girlfriend now. I love this girl. I don't know what you...

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no it's fine. I'm just saying, the Mount Holliston day trips were our thing, you know? She doesn't even know how to board yet.

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's getting better. (then) Now I feel like a dick. You should have said something if it was a problem. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not a problem. It's not. Forget I ever said anything. They see Parker hand Jason something. He pockets it and s glides her way back to the end of the line. She looks up at the guys waiting on the hill and then excitedly waves. Proud of herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan smiles at Lynch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynch and Dan join Parker and slowly work their way up th line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good work!     See?   They always go for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did good, right? LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, so where's my change? PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There isn't any.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gave him the full hundred? PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wasn't going for it at 50. DAN

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: So what happened to the other fifty numbers in between there? Like, I don't know, $51 or maybe even $75? PARKER

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: You gave me two 50's. What was I supposed to do, ask for change? LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would have asked for change. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's still way cheaper than paying for tickets, right? Dan is disappointed. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would have definitely asked him for change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They get up to the front of the line.    Jason looks at D Lynch behind Parker. JASON (scoffs at Parker)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Girlfriends"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker gives him an apologetic smile. The three get in front of the chair. It descends under th and scoops them off of the ground into the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The threesome float high above the mountain as the chair slowly makes it's way to the top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at that. See? All these other idiots are paying top dollar to ski. Not us. All thanks to you, baby. M PARKER (teasing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, now I'm "baby"?     You never call me pet names. DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just not a `pet name' guy.

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: PARKER (to Lynch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He calls me "Parker."

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's your name. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah but you're supposed to call me something affectionate, you know? Like "honey" or "sweetie". LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hooked up with a girl last semester that called me by my last name in bed. It was so weird. "Oh, Lynch! Your hair is so soft! Do me harder, Lynch!" It was like I was throwing it to Dan over here. Dan looks back to Parker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See? At least I don't call you "O'Neil". PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't touch my face enough either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan laughs. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to no one imparticular)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Third wheel. Parker reaches across and playfully taps Lynch. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch it, Lynch. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, that's not fair. I'm not dating you, you don't get to make my life suck. M

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker shoots Dan a look: "Oh, really?" DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wha-? I never said that. I never said you make my life suck. (then, forced) Sweetie.

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: After a beat he awkwardly reaches out and touches her fac Nothing sweet or sensitive about it, but he's trying. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: (sarcastically) Aww! LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Parker) Dan tells me you're getting the hang of that board? PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't say that. But last time we went I did pretty good, right? DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did awesome. I'm telling you, the first few times are frustrating but once you get the hang of it, it's like riding a bike. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAN(cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Lynch's skis) Are you gonna trade in those ancient things for a board? LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. Snowboards are too EMO for me. Give it ten more years and that fad will be dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what they said about rap. Parker removes a cigarette and lights it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmm-mmm. Smell that fresh mountain air, huh? Kind of smells like... cancer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what, I am so sick of potheads giving me shit about smoking butts. M LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least pot does something for you. Cigarettes are just gross. Especially out in the cold. It like sticks to you and then you smell like a mixture of ash tray and an old man's used floss.

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Used floss? Where do you come up with this shit. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: Have you ever sniffed your floss? It's nasty. Dan and Lynch both crack up at this, huge. DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I have never- why would I ever sniff my floss? Why am I friends with you? Parker blows more smoke out. DAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme a drag. He takes her cigarette from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What time do you think we'll get back? I have about 2 weeks worth of chapters to read tonight. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no. She broke the rule.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Parker) Parker you just broke the first rule. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No worrying about the bullshit of real life. The whole point of this

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is to relax and have fun. Worry about school when you get home. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, I haven't read a- M

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chair suddenly stops and lurches forward slightly. sound of the chair lift cuts out. A deep silence takes over quickly, like the type of silen that used to suddenly happen in school when you were taki test and the radiator that you never even noticed was on would suddenly shut off.

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: Random SKIERS and BOARDERS in the surrounding chairs expr their disgust for the delay. Parker instinctively grabs Dan's hand.

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's alright. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-oh! Is someone afraid of heights? PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So it doesn't bother you when I do this? Lynch rocks the chair back and forth. Parker grabs hold of the safety bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quit it! Dan motions to Lynch to stop. PARKER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not afraid of heights.   I just

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: don't like them. DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby, in the whole history of time, only one chair has ever fallen off

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: of a lift. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Points for calling me "baby" but you just made that statistic up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, statistics don't work on smokers. PARKER M

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervous laughter) Oh, shut-up. Lynch turns around and yells behind him. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: Laughter echoes from the chairs behind him. He yells forward.

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: LYNCH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: SOME SKIING
dialogues.text: DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I paid good money. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but I'm gonna pay you back so it's like the same thing. With a lurch, the chair starts moving forward again and t whirring sound of the cables above them start up again. Applause is heard from all of the other chairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYNCH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: WOO
dialogues.text: Dan lets go of Parker's hand and gives her a smile.   She smiles back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He playfully sticks his tongue out at her and she laughs their chair moves forward exiting frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three begin to get situated with their boards and ski PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do I have to wear a helmet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Safety first. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you guys don't wear them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks around. PARKER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I only see little kids wearing them. DAN

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: Cause they're still learning, too. Come on, I'm not gonna argue about this. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: Even extreme boarders wear helmets. Nobody makes fun of them. She begrudgingly puts on her helmet.   She's not happy ab it. Dan and Lynch smile. DAN / LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awww. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're just doing this to make fun of me. Dan's laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm not. I swear.    You look hot in a helmet. Off to the side, Lynch spots SHANNON (cute, brunette, 20' struggling with her boot strap. She falls down on her ass

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynch nonchalantly maneuvers over to her side. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Need some help?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) Do you think? Lynch puts out a hand to help her and pulls her up almost

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: directly into his face. Parker and Dan watch from afar as Lynch helps her with he boot strap. He has one hand innocently on the back of her knee and he M

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: fastening the strap with his other. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aww, check out Lynch. From their point of view, they watch Lynch helping the gi DAN

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: See?   Chick magnet. Almost as if on cue, RYAN (an enormous dude, 20's) stomps over and shoves Lynch down into the snow.

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell? Lynch tries to get up. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woah! Shit, man!    I was just trying to help! Instantly, Dan moves over to Lynch's aid. Parker follows slowly behind him. She's clearly not too good on her boar SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan, what the hell? RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had his hands all over you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No he didn't. I can take care of myself! She shoves him back. Ryan just shakes his head at her and shoves off, away from the group. He waits for her down th hill a few feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan and Shannon help Lynch to his feet. SHANNON (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am so sorry about that. He can

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: be such an asshole sometimes. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was seriously just trying to help. I mean, how could I even

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: compete with a catch like that? He waves to Ryan.   Ryan just looks away. SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs) M

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you OK? LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm fine. SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, thank you for your help.    I am so, so sorry about that.

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: (then) I'm Shannon, by the way. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe.

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling to her) Shan! Shannon rolls her eyes. SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well it was nice to meet you. She takes off after Ryan. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to his friends) I was like one second away from beating that guy's ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you were, man.   Come on. Don't sweat it. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seriously, that guy was such a dick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on boys. We can talk about how tough you both are at the bottom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynch starts down the hill. DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm tough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you are. They push off out of frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan, Parker, and Lynch move down the mountain on their sn boards and skis. Quick cuts of Dan helping Parker learn.    Lynch impatien waits.

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: Finally, Parker comes to a stop on her own next to Dan an claps for her. DAN

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: Look at you! See?   Having fun? PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kidding? We are totally doing this every weekend. In fact, if they were open during the week I'd say we should cut class, too. Lynch suddenly flies over the hill and sprays both of the down with powder. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last one to the bottom is buying dinner! He eats it mere seconds later and lands on his ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker and Dan take off laughing while Lynch feebly tries get back on his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker gets herself some hot chocolate in the distance wh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan and Lynch pick at what's left of a pizza on the table front of them. DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta take a weekend trip up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: North one of these days. Hit up Killington or Okemo and really do it up right. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't we just do it over Christmas. You and me. DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Done. When I stayed with my cousin out West two years ago it was like M

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the stuff you see in commercials. We had to take like 3 lifts to get to the top and it was powder as far as you could see. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, speaking of good skiing... it's been cool doing the bunny hill

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: all day but do you think we could get one real run in before we leave tonight? Dan feels bad.

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, you didn't have to stay with us. It's totally cool if you want to go off for a few. Parker is now walking back to their table behind Lynch an pretty much right on top of them. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's fine. I'm just saying let's step it up a notch at some point. It's been cool watching Parker fall on her ass all day but I would like to actually ski at some point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker feels horrible. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I've probably had enough for today anyway. I can just stay in the lodge if you guys want to go-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Lynch feels horrible. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -no, no, no that's not what I meant. I didn't mean it like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker looks to Dan. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you I didn't have to come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker, I didn't not want you to come. Dan tries to help. M DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was his idea that we invited you in the first place. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. Remember? I was like "Hey man, why doesn't Parker come

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: with us?" And you were like- DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -I was like, "OK that would be cool".

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: Parker isn't buying it.   She puts on a smile. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's OK, you guys. The last thing a girl wants to do is intrude on "guy time". I won't be offended. I've got stuff I could do anyway. (to Dan) Actually, can I have the key? I should check my messages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No locker key. I can tell you right now that every message on there is going to be from your Mom giving you more aggravation about whatever the hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker laughs. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She does not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan looks to Lynch. DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready for this? Two nights ago we were watching a movie and her Mom

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: kept calling and calling. (to Parker) And what did she want? Parker laughs. M DAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wanted to know if we wanted to have chicken soup or vegetable soup with Christmas dinner. Christmas dinner! Four weeks away, and she had to now right then and there what kind of soup we'd prefer.

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you say?   You said chicken. DAN

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: Hell yes, I said chicken, but that's not the point. (to Parker) The point is you can go a few more hours without hearing from Annette. Parker looks to Lynch. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry if I ruined skiing for you today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't! You didn't at all! You missed the part before you walked over here when I was all like, "Dude, this has been so cool...you know...doing..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker and Dan are beaming at him.   He knows he's beat. LYNCH (cont'd) (frustrated)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker, Dan, and Lynch come out of the lodge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From their POV the chair lift is still moving but the lin empty. They start to move to the empty lift line when... M SHANNON (O.C.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe! LYNCH (to his friends)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait up. Lynch walks over to Shannon while Dan and Parker move tow

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: the lift line. SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. I just wanted to apologize again.

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no big deal. He's just lucky he didn't make me mad. You know, I just look half your boyfriend's size. SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ex. He's my ex-boyfriend. We're, you know, trying to still be friends and everything but as you can see, that's not really gonna work. LYNCH (teasing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A group of us all agreed to go skiing this weekend and well, whatever. It's a whole story and- She looks over at Dan and Parker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHANNON (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -I don't want to hold you up. But that was just really embarrassing. So I just wanted to say sorry. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you gonna be here next weekend? LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where, here? Yeah, probably, yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool. Well, my roommate and I come like every Sunday, so maybe I'll see you. LYNCH M

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That would be...a nice time. SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK.   See ya later. She turns and starts walking away. Lynch walks away. He gets a few steps and then turns back

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: and jogs after Shannon again. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, you know what? Would it be cool if I got your number or

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: something? That way I'll...know how to catch up with you and stuff. SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure. Lynch pats his pockets. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. Don't ski with my phone. It's in the locker with everyone else's stuff. Do you have a pen? She laughs and shakes her head no. SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't ski with a pen.     Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just shoot then. I've got a really good memory. I've only smoked pot like 500 times so I'm good. Shannon gets serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know it's a gateway drug right? Joe is nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHANNON (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kidding. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whew.   You! That's so like you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan and Parker are in a heated debate with Jason the chai lift operator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts a red flag on the back of a chair that heads up t mountain. DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we gave you a hundred bucks and we've only gotten like 4 runs!

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not my decision, man.    They're closing early. DAN

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: You're only open three days a week. You can't afford to close early. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you write a letter? Lynch pushes himself up behind them. LYNCH (to Dan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember "429". DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just remember "429". (to himself)
PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jason)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, just one more run. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honestly, I'd slide you some more money but we gave you everything we have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jason) Hey man, do you have a pen? Jason ignores him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not about the money. They need to clear the mountain. We've got weather coming in. There's nothing I can do. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if we promise to run straight

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: down. Like the quickest run ever. DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wicked fast.

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: Jason struggles. He sighs and looks around.        There plenty of skiers coming down. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. But hurry.

dialogues.speaker: DAN PARKER
dialogues.text: Thank you!                           Thank you so much! DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be wicked fast.    Like the wind! Jason sends them up the lift.    He checks to make sure n is watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker, Dan, and Lynch slowly move up the mountain yet ag LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seriously. For a hundred bucks

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: you'd think he could cut us some slack. DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know right? They're supposed to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: stay open until 10 on Sundays. Whatever happened to night skiing? LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wachusett still has night skiing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should have gone there. It's kinda like Ward Hill but not as lame. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you remember the numbers I told you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAN
PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good for you, Lynch.   You got her number!

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did He-Man have to say about that? LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: That guy? Who cares? Steroids shrink your dick. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, shit. What were my four numbers? "5022". Parker, will you remember "5022"? PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason reaches for his cigarettes.    He's all out. Disappointed he tosses the empty pack in the trash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fellow employee (RIFKIN) approaches. RIFKIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early night, huh? JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not gonna hear me complain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RIFKIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pendergraft wants you to stop by the office.   Something about next weekend's schedule.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not working next weekend. Rifkin gives him a look.   "That's what you thought."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JASON (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, come on. It's my brother's bachelor party. I put in for it two months ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RIFKIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go talk to the boss. He's getting ready to leave. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the best man! (under his breath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: Rifkin takes his place. RIFKIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready to shut down?

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: As Jason runs away he turns back. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's three more on their way down. Wait for them, then it's all set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three continue to talk. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not waiting til we get back to campus to eat. I'm starving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you have some pizza? PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean the cardboard with tomato sauce that you guys ate? That wasn't pizza. That was like,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `roller skating rink birthday party pizza'. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a Papa Gino's on our way

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: back. It's like 15 minutes down the road from the mountain. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweet. I am gonna eat a whole real

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: pizza myself. Dan spies something. DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check it out! M

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look down to see THREE SKIERS hit a huge jump, one a the other. DAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are so hitting that jump. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: Last run. Gotta make it count. The wind blows the chair really hard. Parker holds on.

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus! The guys just laugh. DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just wind, Parker. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you mean, "baby"? Parker starts laughing. DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Lynch) Who invited you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rifkin warms his hands with his breath.       The tempera dropping fast. He checks his watch, dancing back and forth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEYMAN (another employee) runs by him on his way to the lodge. RIFKIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heyman!    HEY, HEYMAN!   Do me a solid? Heyman looks back him.   His face already says "no."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RIFKIN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've gotta piss so bad I can taste it. Can you just take over for 2 minutes? Heyman points to his ears as if he can't hear what Rifkin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: saying to him. He keeps running. RIFKIN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asshole.

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: A low, distant thunder roll echoes far away. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.   Do you hear that?

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the mountains.    It snows every night. Relax. The chair moves on in silence for a few moments. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seriously. I'm gonna eat a whole pizza. (a few beats)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not even kidding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rifkin kicks his feet around. He spies Jason's discarded cigarette box on the top of the trash and he inspects it any left over cigarettes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. He sighs. Just then, the three skiers that we saw taking the jump a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: minutes earlier come flying down the mountain and past hi A voice from the top lift cuts through the radio. VOICE (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last chair is through. Rifkin picks up the radio and calls the top of the mounta RIFKIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool. Last three just hit.   I'm

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: clear. VOICE (O.C.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clear up here. He hangs up and moves over to the lever. Tight on the lever as he pulls it back towards him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chair lurches to a stop. Once again, the comforting

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: white noise of the motorized cables goes away, leaving th in silence. The wind blows hard against them. DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, come on. Parker instinctively grabs his hand. The cold bites through their layers of clothing. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bur!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYNCH (yelling to the sky)

dialogues.speaker: FOR THIS CRAP
dialogues.text: They sit and wait in silence for a few seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gonna start again, right? DAN (quickly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyone got any jokes? LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did the fourteen year old girl from New Hampshire say to her father when she lost her virginity? DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Get off me, you're crushing my

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marlboros". Beat. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From this distance the mountain looks like a giant night-

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: light of converging white strings. Even in this darkness, the menacing clouds are visible ov the trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three sit in the freezing chair.   Lynch is really ge impatient. DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think the worst way to die would be?

dialogues.speaker: PARKER
dialogues.text: That's not morbid.

dialogues.speaker: LYNCH
dialogues.text: Yeah, seriously.    That's kinda spooky, Dan.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I think getting eaten by a shark would be the worst way to go. (beat) Not if it was like one of those

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: surfers where they get hit from behind and they don't even know what happened. (beat) You know. Cause it like came up A

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: from beneath them. (beat) Like on the Jaws poster.

dialogues.speaker: LYNCH
dialogues.text: The chick on the Jaws poster was

dialogues.speaker: M
dialogues.text: hot.

dialogues.speaker: PARKER
dialogues.text: She was?

dialogues.speaker: LYNCH
dialogues.text: I don't know. She was naked. Naked chicks are hot.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: But if you actually like saw the fin coming for you in the water. That would be worse than actually

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: getting eaten. Knowing that this animal is coming for you but you can't get away. And that it's going to eat you. Like you're gonna get eaten alive? Have you guys ever seen that footage of the great white jumping out of the water to eat that seal?

dialogues.speaker: LYNCH
dialogues.text: That's why I only swim in pools.

dialogues.speaker: PARKER
dialogues.text: I think burning to death would be the worst.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well yes and no. Because most people die of the smoke inhalation before any fire even hits them. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remember watching TV for like 3

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: days straight after 9/11. That footage that they kept showing of all of those people leaping off of the top of the Trade Center? Can you imagine how bad it was inside

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: to know that jumping was a better way out? LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But they say that when you jump

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: from that high up your heart stops before you hit the ground and you don't even feel it. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, then Lynch. What is the worst M

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: way to die? LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (defensive) What? PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you have an answer for

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: everything. What's your biggest fear? Lynch has been waiting for this.

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy.   The Sarlaac pit. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The what? LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sarlaac pit. From Return of the Jedi? Hel-lo...being slowly digested over 1,000 years? Worst. Death. Ever. DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (teasing) "I don't know why I never have a girlfriend, you guys!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut-up. The wind starts blowing again and Parker nestles close to Dan. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why hasn't it started again? DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give it a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is nothing man. At Stowe last year, me and Solet were stranded for like 25 minutes. This big chick fell getting off up top and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: twisted her leg. It was like- "move her to the side and keep the line going people". But no. They had to stop and celebrate it right there and we all had to-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOM.   The lights go out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across the mountain all of the trail lights go out, one b one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sit in darkness.

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: At first no one can speak. Dan reacts first. DAN (yelling)

dialogues.speaker: WHAT THE FUCK HELLO
dialogues.text: LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on now! This is messed up. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: HELLO
dialogues.text: Dan tries to laugh in frustration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are they fucking kidding? LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I kind of just shat in my pants a bit, I'm not gonna lie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAN

dialogues.speaker: HE-LLO
dialogues.text: Parker is starting to shake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) No one knows we're up here.    They forgot that we're up here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No they didn't. They couldn't have. I'm sure they have a system or something. There's probably security cameras on us right now. M

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts waving around his hands. DAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: WE'RE FREEZING UP HERE
dialogues.text: PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if they don't start it again?

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: What if everyone went home? DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angered out of panic) Will you stop?!

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: (recovering) They didn't go home. Stop freaking me out. (then) Remind me to knock down that fucking lift operator when we get down. This is horse shit. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you say to the guy? DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me?   Nothing! LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, clearly you pissed him off enough to do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't do anything!   He knows we're still up here. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why are the lights off, Dan? Is that part of their policy? Shut

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: off the lights and scare the customers? DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They just lost power or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure it's gonna come back on any second. (then) They didn't go home. That's retarded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a few more moments. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is so messed up. M DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a power outage. They'll come up with a ladder if they have to. Parker is starting to whimper. In a few more seconds she even be teetering on full-on panic. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: We need to get down from here. We can't just sit up here. Why isn't the goddamn chair moving, Dan? What the hell?!

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well you being all psycho about it isn't gonna make it move. Just chill out. Another few beats. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't yell at me. DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't yelling at you but you need to relax. This stuff happens all the time. Can you imagine the law suit if they left everyone on this lift up here all night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Free lift tickets. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What other people on the lift? There was no one in front of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She made a good point.   But still... DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We won't be stuck here all night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You're right. We won't be here all night. It's Sunday. (she starts crying) Its fucking Sunday and they aren't

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: open again until Friday. (sobbing) We'll be stuck here all week. Silence as Dan and Lynch take this in. M PARKER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna die up here. Lynch tries to be the voice of reason. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not going to be stuck here. Parker. Parker, look at me. Even

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: if by some strange reason they really did forget us up here- we can jump. I see people jump off of chair lifts all the time.

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's true. I've done it before. You just get tired of waiting, you wait for a spot with some serious powder and you just jump. It's actually kind of fun, but they can ban you from the mountain for it. Looking below them, it is way too far a drop to be jumpin off of the chair. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hysterical)

dialogues.speaker: US
dialogues.text: She cries into Dan's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shh. I know you're scared. I'm scared, too. But any minute now they're gonna turn the power back on and we're all gonna be laughing about this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More moments pass in silence as they survey their situati Finally... PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to pee. They all share an uncomfortable laugh. PARKER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to pee wicked bad. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That makes two of us. PARKER M

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ew, Lynch if you pull out your junk in front of me I'm gonna puke. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what do you want me to do?   I gotta go. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: How am I supposed to go? Dan moves the safety bar a little. DAN

dialogues.speaker: E
