dialogues.text: Maybe, they'll need to do maintenance on the lift or something, you know? DAN (O.C.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on up there?     You guys? PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're right here, baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, man. We didn't go anywhere. I think...I think I'm gonna try and climb back to the pole. If the chair is close enough, maybe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: maybe I can jump to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan is in agony.

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it.   Please do it now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just hang in there, Dan.     It's gonna be OK. Lynch starts to maneuver himself in the chair. Slowly he pushes himself up so that he is sitting on the chair back holding onto the connecting post. The chair swings back and forth in the wind. Above him it is a solid 5 feet before the chair arm conne to the wire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's funny. But I was never afraid of heights, until like...right now. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can I do to help?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just hold on to my legs. You can't really stop me from falling...but it's, you know...psychological or something you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker maneuvers herself to hold Joe's legs.. Joe tries to move into a standing position, but panics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYNCH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK...OK...just give me a second. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we should wait til morning. We can make it a few more hours. M LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) Us? Maybe. (then) But not him. The gravity of this settles in.

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: As Lynch gets ready to try and stand again...we hear something in the surrounds. They freeze.

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: Again, a sort of "moan" rings in the distance. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby, is that you? DAN (O.C.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shh! They listen again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This time, clear as day...a WOLF HOWL. DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, motherfucker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynch tries to control the panic. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's alright man. It's just a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: coyote or something. They're scared of people. It probably won't even come anywhere near us,

dialogues.speaker: OK
dialogues.text: DAN (O.C.) M

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That sounded like a fucking wolf. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just relax. When's the last time you heard of a wolf attack in New England?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even in the pale moonlight, it is easy to see how white D

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: is becoming. DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I read about one on-line somewhere last year. Fuck. Fuck. Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wolves around here are pussies. They aren't even that big. They stop and listen...but there is only the sound of the rain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It could be worse, right? DAN (O.C.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How the hell...could this be worse? Long pause...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It could be the Sarlacc Pit. They can't believe it...but Dan and Lynch both actually

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: laugh. It's uncomfortable and forced as hell. But it's a laugh. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker- coming through with the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: tension breaker, look out! (to Dan) She's alright, Walker. Your girl is alright. He focuses on the task at hand again. M LYNCH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK...here we go. Slowly he pushes up on the back of the chair again. With hand on Parker's shoulder and another on the back post of chair, Lynch gets to his feet. Looking down at the drop, instantly crouches down again.

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: LYNCH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit, is that high up. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: What can I do? LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.   Just be quiet. He psyches himself up again and starts to rise up. DAN (O.C.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can do this, Lynch.     You've got it. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please stop talking. He puts one foot up on the top of the chair back...but it slips off to the side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYNCH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woa-! The whole back of this thing is ice. Together, he and Parker start hitting the chair back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shards of ice fall down around Dan.   He covers his head

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: protection. LYNCH (O.C.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on, down there. I think once I can stand on the back- I should

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: be able to reach the top. More chunks of ice shower down around Dan. Finally the falling ice subsides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan takes his gloves away from his face...only to freeze horror. Not even 10 feet away, stands a WOLF. Silently the wolf watches him from the bushes.   Lightly growling.

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: DAN (quietly at first)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys. The wolf gives a low growl.

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: DAN (cont'd) (really loud)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?   What's wrong? DAN (O.C.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a wolf down here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynch and Parker look down. From their POV they can see t the wolf is standing right next to Dan, watching him. No fear. PARKER (gasps)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan doesn't take his eyes off of the wolf.      He is sha fear. DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell do I do? The wolf sniffs at the air and then growls again, this ti baring it's teeth. It smells the blood. DAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: WHAT THE FUCK DO I DO
dialogues.text: The tension builds in the stand-off. Neither the wolf or Dan look away.    When... SLAM!   Lynch's other ski lands between the two of them.

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: PARKER (O.C.) (screaming)

dialogues.speaker: GET AWAY FROM HIM
dialogues.text: The wolf steps back and snarls.

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: THWOCK! Parker's snowboard comes down and skids away into the trees, pushing the wolf further back. The wolf darts back into the bushes. Though it can no lon be seen, we can hear it moving away through the brush and back into the darkness. Growls come from the surrounding bushes as the wolf angri retreats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you alright man? DAN (O.C.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.   I'm alive. Lynch slides his remaining pole in between the bars on th chair back and rests it there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See? What did I tell you? They're more scared of you than you are of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAN (O.C.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I'm pretty scared, I gotta be honest. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just a dog. That's all it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He won't be back. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you keeping warm down there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As warm as I can. (then)

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: I can't feel my legs anymore. Is that bad? I mean, it doesn't hurt as much...but that's bad right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no. You'll be alright. (quietly to Parker)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's probably really bad. I gotta move, so I need you to-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks closely at Parker's face. The tip of her nose an the tops of her cheeks look as if there is black soot on them. LYNCH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey...go like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He motions wiping his face. Parker follows suit, but winces in pain. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow!   It feels like...like sunburn. Pieces of her chapped skin are stuck to her icy glove. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not an expert but I think that's frost bite. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? M LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at me- is my face changing color anywhere? Parker looks as closely as she can. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't..I can't see anything.    I

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: don't know, it's too dark She starts rubbing at her cheek again. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: No!   Stop touching it.   Don't touch it. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it itches now... LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know- but if you keep touching your face it's gonna rub off. Parker is terrified. LYNCH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just try and cover your face.    Try and stay warm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Staying warm is absolutely impossible. Parker hides her exposed hand deeper inside her wet jacket. Icicles dangle from the bottom of the chair and their clothing. DAN (O.C.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (winded) You gotta move faster up there. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying man, I'm trying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynch slowly lifts himself up onto the back of the chair, which bends at an awkward angle. From above him we can see the long drop down, and as he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: slowly starts to maneuver his body up to the top of the c arm- the height looks `stomach droppingly' scary. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Careful. M LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop talking. DAN (O.C.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynch.   I think the- LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: Silence. Lynch gets his gloved hands around the top of the cable. is frozen over with a thick layer of ice.

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: The distance to the next chair seems about 10 times as fa now. LYNCH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) I can do this. If Jenny Bluth could climb the rope, I can totally do this. Slowly, he wraps his arms around the wire, now with his f body weight on the back of the chair. The bolt holding the arm into place on the cabling starts creak. It bends slightly, but seems to hold firm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYNCH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: OK. OK. OK.
dialogues.text: He starts to pull himself up onto the cable. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't look down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With one hand in front of the other, Lynch hoists himself about two feet off of the chair and into the air. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gritted teeth) Slippery. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you got it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shh. He slides out a little bit more, his feet dangling high a the ground. M

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cable clangs somewhere to the front and back of Lynch The noise is almost refreshing in the silent ice covered wilderness. With another deep breath, Lynch moves another two feet ou over the sky. He is straining hard.

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: Another two feet out.    He looks down for the first time He sees something that scares the shit out of him. LYNCH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: Oh god. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong? LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please no.     Please no... He starts to pull himself back to the chair, quickly. DAN (O.C.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Lynch! You had it! Lynch gets his foot on the icy chair back and tries to balance his weight on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SWISH! His foot slips off of it and he almost falls...but Parker grabs onto his coat. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got you. Lynch scrambles into the chair and huddles next to Parker

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PARKER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong? He looks at her, icy tears in his eyes.    His face is wh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PARKER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened? Finally Lynch grabs her face in his hands.    He gets clo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: her. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't look down. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? He grabs her head forcefully, trying to cover her ears. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't look down there, Parker. The camera booms up and above them. As it tilts down at

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: them...we reveal Dan splayed out on the ground below. Out of the darkness of the bushes...a pack of SIX WOLVES slowly and silently descends on him from all angles.

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: DAN (O.C.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynch?   What's wro-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan hears the first growl. DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit.   Oh shit. The hungry wolves circle around him.   The smell of his freezing blood makes them drool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAN (cont'd) (yelling up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynch doesn't look down.       He just stares at Parker. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fighting tears)

dialogues.speaker: YEAH, MAN.
dialogues.text: DAN (O.C.) (crying)

dialogues.speaker: DON'T LET HER LOOK.
dialogues.text: LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: I WON'T.
dialogues.text: DAN (O.C.)

dialogues.speaker: DON'T YOU FUCKING LET HER LOOK.
dialogues.text: Lynch is trying to cover Parker's ears...but she can hear what they are saying. She forces her head free and steals glance down. She sees Dan's untimely death approaching and instantly starts to scream and cry.

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: Lynch holds her head in a vice grip. He presses his foreh into hers. Her tears and snot overflow onto his gloves. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: Shhhh. Don't listen to it.        Don't listen. Don't listen. As we push in tight on the two of their faces, below them hear the wolves begin their attack on their defenseless p First one growl and a bite. Dan shrieks in pain. DAN (O.C.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't let her look! Below we can hear him put up a fight. But the attacks and bites get more frequent and his screams even more painful

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAN (O.C.) (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't look! Don't you fucking look down here! The sound of several wolves attacking in unison over powe his cries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynch continues to hold his hands over Parker's ears and her eyes pointed at his as the sounds of Dan's demise ech through the night. The sounds of clothes being shredded, flesh being torn, a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: bones popping from their joints creates a chorus of pain below. Dan doesn't scream as much as does cry out in pain and ag

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera never sees it.   Only Lynch and Parker's faces After what seems to be an unbearable minute...the sounds below begin to dissipate. Eventually Dan's remains can be heard dragging away. M

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence once again. Finally, Lynch let's go of Parker's head. He sobs into hi own frozen gloves as Parker hysterically screams out into night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker's screams echo across the dark wilderness.   Somew

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: in the distance, birds take off in fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynch and Parker sit on the frozen chair, shivering. They are now in the devastating silence that has fallen a what must have been endless screaming and crying. Only th occasional sniffle lets us know that they are even awake. Finally Lynch breaks the silence. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should...try and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to try and sit up on the back of the chair agai continue his climbing effort. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (emotionless) Why did you let him jump?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynch turns and looks at her in disbelief. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't be fucking serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was too far. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said he could do it. You didn't

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: try and stop him! (then) I can't believe this?! You're blaming me? PARKER M

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not...I'm not blaming you. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're his girlfriend! I didn't see you throwing yourself in front of him! PARKER

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: He wasn't going to listen to me. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, but he would have listened to me? I said it was a bad idea! I

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: said it was too far a drop! But I didn't hear any better ideas out of you except for crying about it! Don't you fucking blame me! You've been his girlfriend, for what? A year maybe? I've known him my whole fucking life! PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you... You should have... LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?   Say it. Parker looks at him, uncertain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYNCH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say it!   It should have been me? PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't say that. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you want to! It's OK. I get it. It should have been me down there cause who gives a fuck about me, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker feels terrible.    She puts her hand on his should PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, I-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynch shrugs her hand off of him. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what? If we hadn't spent the whole fucking day on the bunny slope watching you fall on your ass M

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: we would have gotten some real runs in and we could have just gone home! PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: You're sorry? Maybe if you hadn't fucked with our thing... maybe if you had just stayed home and not forced yourself into every aspect of his life... maybe my best friend

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: wouldn't be dead right now! PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not fair! LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it's not fair that my best friend is DEAD! Parker begins to sob. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry! I didn't mean it!     I'm just- I'm just- LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -Fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynch is numb.    He sits expressionless.   Seething. In her crying, Parker slowly keeps moving towards him. Li a puppy who knows they did something wrong and only wants to love it again. Finally she gets next to him and buries her head in his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: chest, letting it all out. Eventually, Lynch can't help but feel compassion for her. puts his arm around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYNCH (cont'd) (quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I'm sorry, Parker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snow has now almost completely covered any of Dan's remai that were left on the scene. Only the tip of a boot and a piece of jacket are visible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker and Lynch are shivering together. After a beat, they begin to banter again. Everything is s in a monotone voice. They never even look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: They only speak to be speaking. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 5...5...shit, what was it?    5520?
PARKER
LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 5022. 429-5022. I'm so gonna call that girl when we get home. And you know what? I'm gonna marry her. No messing around. I'm just gonna be like "Hey Shannon, it's me Joe from the chair lift. Will you marry me?" And then we're gonna get a house and have 2 kids and a dog named Steve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker's face is expressionless. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's gonna pay for the house. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She will.    Shannon's got a great

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: job. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does she do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynch makes something up...but continues to have no expression in his words. Despite his talk, his spirit is shattered. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She...an orthodontist. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orthodontists make a lot of money. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet you guys will be really happy. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wolf settles in the bushes and looks up at the two "pie

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: of food" on the chair high above. Another wolf lays down in the snow by a tree. They wait like vultures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.   Then... PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who names their dog "Steve". LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve's a "people" name. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Says who? PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't like walk into someone's house and have them say "Here's my dog Steve." LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?    Steve's a good name for a dog. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Here, meet my cat Chris."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No cats.    Just a dog.   Steve. Silence. M PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shayna must be so hungry. Lynch tries to change the subject. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of pizza should we get at Papa Gino's?

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: Parker doesn't hear him. As she continues, wet snow start to fall around them and the icy wind starts to pick up. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: The poor thing. She's just a puppy. She won't understand that I died. She's gonna think I left her. That I forgot about her. All she wants is for me to come home. She's probably waiting by the door for me right now. Every sound she hears in the hallway she's probably cocking her little head to the side, waiting to see if I'm going to walk in. But I won't. I won't ever walk in. And Shayna's going to starve to death. The poor thing is gonna wither away and die waiting by the door for me and it's all my fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She won't starve to death and you're not going to die. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one else has a key to my place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The neighbors will break the door down if she doesn't stop barking. Someone will figure it out. She'll be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) And so will you. So will we. He puts an arm around her and huddles closely trying to shield the wind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would have had Shayna for a year this month. I got her a year ago for Christmas. M LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.   But you'll see her again. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan and I were spending Christmas with my parents this year. We won't be there though. (then)

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: I want to see my Mom and my Dad. (then) I want to open presents in the morning and then wait for my grandmother to show up so we can

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: eat. She's always late. But she brings all of the desserts. And she makes this special hot apple cider thing with cinnamon and nutmeg. It's so good. And after dinner my Dad always passes out on the couch `cause it's his one day off and he's had too much eggnog. And my sister, my Mom, and I watch A Christmas Story until the marathon is over. And that's how you know Christmas is really over. When Ralphie gets his Red Rider carbine-action two-hundred-shot range model air rifle that last time and they go back to their regular programming. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PARKER(cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's kind of sad because then you know you have to wait another year for Christmas again. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the same routine every year. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want to see my Mom and Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera pulls back wider and wider until their chair i lost in the wet snowfall and darkness. Slowly we fade to black as the wind howls and thunder gen rolls...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dawn is breaking over the trees. Lynch and Parker are still. Their bodies are huddled M

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: together, but neither is moving. In fact, at a first glance, one might think they are both human popcycles. The dark splotches of frost-bite on Parker's nose and che have now grown to what almost looks like patches of black fungus on her skin.

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: Lynch has the start of his own frost-bite on his ears and nose. Slowly, Parker's eyes flutter and she awakens.

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: Her eyes search around as the realization that this was n all just a bad dream sinks in. She adjusts in her seat and feels something pull. She win and looks down. Slowly the camera follows her stare down reveal her bare hand, gripping the icy safety bar. She pulls...but her skin is stuck to the frozen metal. Beginning to panic, she jerks her hand hard, taking the b up about half an inch with it. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Painstakingly slow, she begins to peel her hand off of th bar. A sound that resembles `jeans slowly tearing' can be soft heard as she moves her arm forward and separates her hand from the skin that is attached to the metal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After what feels like an eternity, she gives her hand one last jerk, freeing it from the safety bar. PARKER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruuugh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her movement startles Lynch awake, and he bolts upright a from a `falling nightmare'. Discombobulated, Lynch turns back and forth frantically

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: trying to get his bearings. Parker is crying and holding her bloody hand, PARKER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhhh. M

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynch, bug-eyed, takes in the world around him. A fresh coat of snow has covered everything in several in of peaceful white bliss. Below them, the snow has completely covered Dan's remains There is nothing left to show that there was ever even a

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: struggle. Parker hides her bloody hand back inside of her coat, awa from Lynch's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I...thought I was dreaming.   This. I thought this was a dream. He turns to look at Parker. It takes everything he has to not jolt back in horror at how bad her face looks. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your frost-bite.   It's getting...worse. She starts to touch her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?    How bad is it? Lynch stops her. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't.    It's bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not as itchy any more. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just don't touch your face, OK? When we get out of here, we'll get you to a doctor right away and they'll fix it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have some dark spots on your face, too. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll fix me, too then.   Just M

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: don't touch it. He looks around, front to back.   In daylight it's easier see the other chairs. His breath blows out of his body in huge plumes of mist. LYNCH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: Well, it's morning. Maybe someone will come up here now. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Mountain maintenance. Besides, when none of us show up for class people are going to start looking for us. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one's gonna look for me. I skip class all the time. By the time anyone notices I'm gone I'll be dead. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you please just think ONE positive thing? Please!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Besides.   No one knows we're here. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the sky)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His voice echoes off of the frozen trees, almost as if taunting him. He turns around to look at the chairs behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYNCH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright. Look. If I can get to that chair...two back...I could make it to the ladder on that pole. I think I could make it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker doesn't speak. LYNCH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me. M PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure you don't just wanna give it a few more hours? What if you're right? What if someone is going to come up here, even though they're not open today? Lynch doesn't respond. The look on his face says that "no

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: one is coming" but he decides there's no harm in waiting a little while longer. Lynch tries to yell for help again, though his soar throa making it almost impossible to scream.

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: UP HERE
dialogues.text: Once again...only echoes. He re-settles in his chair. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wish I could stand up. Get out of this position for a minute. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you want, you can stand on the chair and I can hold onto you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.     I can't. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if anything's gonna get you over your fear of heights, it's this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PARKER (quickly, sternly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bottom of the mountain looks like it has been abandon Empty ski racks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An empty lodge. An empty parking lot. A still chair lift. All covered in white, still snow.

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: Lynch is sleeping. His head is leaned to one side in a position that is sure to give him the worst stiff neck he ever had. Parker is ancy.    She looks all around.   Thinking. Finally she squeezes her eyes shut...embarrassed. Her snow pants turn dark around her bottom. Slowly a pudd of urine forms on the chair between her and Lynch. Below them, the urine falls into the snow and disappears. Parker's eyes swell as she begins to cry what's left of h tears. She is emotionally degraded and devastated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As her nose begins to run, she instinctively wipes her ha across it...taking a small piece of the dead flesh off of cheek with it. She doesn't even feel it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, Lynch stirs and checks Parker to see if she is s breathing. It appears she is not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey...hey Parker... He lightly shakes her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. LYNCH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker wake up. He shakes her harder and she comes to with a gasp. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: What? LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, I thought you stopped breathing...

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: He notices her skinned cheek.    Her ear tips are now completely blackened. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong? LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. She studies his eyes.    Clearly something is very wrong. LYNCH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about you help me up again and we try and get out of here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From beneath the chair we see shards of ice and snow fall

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: onto the ground. Lynch is once again trying to maneuver himself up onto th chair back as Parker holds him steady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: OK. 1...2...3-
dialogues.text: He hoists himself up onto the cable briefly, but after ju few seconds, he returns his feet to the chair back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker holds onto his legs tightly. LYNCH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel like I gained about 100 pounds overnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was all that pizza talk. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no strength. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: Then don't do this. Lynch tries again. He hoists himself up, but bails instantly...like a trainer giving up on his 100th pull up

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it. He settles back down into the assumed position on the cha PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe later. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Like I'm gonna feel better if I wait a little longer? I should have done it last night while I still had some strength.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's more snow fall on the ground and it's all fresh. Maybe the jump won't be as bad now. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even if it was a foot deeper- it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: wouldn't break that fall. I should have just climbed across last night. I had strength. I had adrenaline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want me to do? LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.   Let's sit and do nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reaches into her pocket and removes her cigarettes. box is damp, but the cigarettes inside are still dry. She starts to remove one but her gloved left hand and her numb right hand make her fumble the pack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pack of cigarettes falls into the snow.

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: PARKER (O.C.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two are bundled together as the evening winds start t pick up. Again, they speak without emotion. It's conversation just let themselves know that they are still alive. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come you never have a girlfriend? LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How am I supposed to answer that?

dialogues.speaker: PARKER
dialogues.text: I mean, you're a decent guy. Girls dig you. But you never stay in a relationship.

dialogues.speaker: LYNCH
dialogues.text: I had a serious girlfriend once.

dialogues.speaker: PARKER
dialogues.text: High School doesn't count.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, post-high school.   Freshmen year.

dialogues.speaker: PARKER
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: LYNCH
dialogues.text: This girl Annie. I met her at orientation. We emailed all summer and when we started school, it was like we were already going out. I

dialogues.speaker: M
dialogues.text: totally just felt it with her, you know? We were into a lot of the same stuff, which was cool. She was way into Aerosmith. I had seen them fifteen times, she had seen them twenty. How cool is that?

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: LYNCH
dialogues.text: She um... same favorite movie as me. E.T. It was like soul mates

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: and that stuff you read about.

dialogues.speaker: PARKER
dialogues.text: So then... what happened?

dialogues.speaker: LYNCH
dialogues.text: Same old shit. (then) No. You know what happened? She liked another guy. This fucking fraternity douchebag named Dean who kept sending her flowers and stuff. I don't know who it was exactly, but every time I'd go to her room some guy named "Dean" had left her notes and shit.

dialogues.speaker: PARKER
dialogues.text: Why did she keep it? Was she trying to make you jealous?

dialogues.speaker: LYNCH
dialogues.text: I don't know. I think she just liked getting attention.

dialogues.speaker: PARKER
dialogues.text: So she dumped you for a frat guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I dumped her. We were in the cafeteria, right? And I was sitting facing her, facing the wall...and she was facing everyone in the cafeteria behind me. And I A

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: kept seeing her smiling at someone behind me and like, almost laughing. So I was like, "who are you laughing at?" You know? Like "what the hell is going on?" And she's like, "Dean's making fun of

dialogues.speaker: M
dialogues.text: you." (beat) So I turn around, and I'm like ready to kick the shit out of this guy. And all I see is a sea of fucking random people. Just all of these faces. This guy could see me and was making eyes with my

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: girlfriend...but I couldn't see him.

dialogues.speaker: PARKER
dialogues.text: That's messed up.

dialogues.speaker: LYNCH
dialogues.text: I've never felt so stupid and bad in my life. (then) So I left.

dialogues.speaker: PARKER
dialogues.text: You just walked out?

dialogues.speaker: LYNCH
dialogues.text: Yup. Told her to go laugh with "Dean the Frat guy". I was out.

dialogues.speaker: PARKER
dialogues.text: That sucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe... maybe I shouldn't have been so quick to walk out. Maybe I needed to have a thicker skin and not be such a sensitive bitch, I don't know. Sometimes I think I was just insecure and maybe I

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: screwed up. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should call her. When you get home. You could tell her that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't. (laughs) She's dating Dean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emotion has fought it's way to the surface again.   Parke Lynch share a nervous laugh together. She turns away from him. M

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a few seconds, her laughs turn to tears. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should have done something. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was nothing either of us could have done.

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sat here and let him die. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: No, you didn't. We didn't let him die. There was nothing we could have done. He jumped down there to try and save us, OK? PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was the one. He was the boy I was gonna marry. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funny story. First grade, we all get left there for the day by our mom's. You know, alone in real school for the first time without our folks around. And Dan... Dan was this sort of chubby kid when he was little...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker laughs. LYNCH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, fuck it. He was a fat ass. Parker laughs harder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYNCH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And all the mom's left and he just wouldn't let go of his mom's hand. He just stood there after she left, at the front of the room, crying

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: like a total pussy. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like Dan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have no idea. But then, the teacher... Mrs... What was her name? Mrs. Schifrin? She was trying everything to get the fat kid to stop crying. And so she M

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: says, "Well Dan, is there anyone else in the class that you know?" You know, like, "Maybe there's a friend you'd like to sit with?" And the fucker points right at me and says "him"! I had never seen this kid before in my life, you know? But for whatever reason, he

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: points right at me. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And so he had to sit with you?

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a week! For my whole first week of school I'm sharing my little cubby desk with his fat ass! Parker laughs through her tears. LYNCH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Douchebag.     I never let him forget it. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I loved him so much. Lynch is determined.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But if he died only for you and me to give up and die up here, that's bullshit. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I need you to pull it together, and we're gonna get out of this shit. We're gonna get out of this

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: for Dan. Alright? PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynch bites his severely chapped lips. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynch feebly climbs up on the chair back and reaches up f the cables. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: OK....let's try this again. He steadies himself on the chair, which sways in the wind TIGHT ON the bolts connecting the arm to the cables.   Th

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: metal is bending with a light squeaking sound. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you OK? Do you have it? Lynch just grunts as he reaches and tries to steady himse on the chair that is swinging at an odd angle under his weight. The camera swivels up to reveal his shaky feet trying to footing on the chair back and the ground far below him. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rrruh! He pushes off hard and grabs on to the cabling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As his foot pushes fast on the chair, it swings at an impossible angle. TIGHT ON the connecting bolts as one of them SNAPS! PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chair leans hard to the right side, forcing Parker to slide down into what is now the bottom corner of the chai The chair is still in place, but it is now hanging by one

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: bolt and at a severe angle. PARKER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe!    JOE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe tries to look back over his shoulder, struggling to k himself on the cable against his own body weight and wet clothing. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!    Hold on, just hold on! M

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another grunt and Lynch makes another big move forward. The camera booms up above him, shooting straight down at distance between his dangling body and the frozen ground. Tight on his gloved hands as they slowly slide forward on metal cable.

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: Lynch squeezes his eyes shut and takes another reach forw Behind him, Parker looks on in agony.      She is holding breath and whispering...

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispered) Please God...please God....please God... The metal arm above her groans under the pressure that th one remaining bolt is under. Looking at the arm in this state, it is especially eerie to imagine how these metal chairs even stay attached to the cables in the first plac Lynch takes another move forward. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rrrugh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can do it. Please do it. Lynch reaches forward again...and his hand slips on the i cable. He momentarily hangs by one arm. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arrrrr! PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches up and grabs hold again...his strength is wean LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through gritted teeth) Got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another few quick reaches forward and he is more than hal across to the next chair. From Lynch's point of view we can see his feet floating a the earth and hear the sound of his own heart beat. His o M

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: pained breathing fills his ears. It's only now that he sees two of the wolves watching him from the bushes. LYNCH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Motherfucker.

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: The wind blows hard against him, swaying his body back an forth as he momentarily rests. LYNCH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got an audience.

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: Parker looks down, just in time to see one of the wolves back into the bushes. Her movement makes the chair groan harder. The cable twan loudly between Lynch's shaky movements and the twisted me that holds the arm in place. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chair is gonna fall! LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.    No it's not. Slowly he makes his way the remaining distance and positi himself over the other chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drops down onto it, sending shards of ice cascading do into the snow below. He quickly sits down, breathing heavy and clutching the s of the chair. LYNCH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take that Jenny Bluth! PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You made it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet.   Halfway. He looks behind him at the next chair. Just a few feet ba from it is the giant green lift pole... and a ladder!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYNCH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. He stands up on the chair and reaches up to the cable. weak. M

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very weak. LYNCH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker. I want you to throw my extra pole as far as you can this way.

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: She can't quite hear him. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said THROW MY POLE AS FAR AS YOU CAN THIS WAY. When I get on the ground I'll need some defense. Parker nods. She takes Lynch's ski pole and tries to throw it as far a she can back at him. The action forces another terrifying metallic groan from arm above her, and her chair swings back and forth from t motion. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pole lands under the second chair, splitting the dist between where she is and where the tree is. PARKER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Halfway to me is better than up there with you, right? (to himself) Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to pull himself up again, but turns back to Par one more time. The chair has settled down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYNCH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay perfectly still. I'm gonna get you home, OK? He pulls himself up, straining hard. M LYNCH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rrrrugh! This gets the wolves attention. In the bushes their ears and eyes perk up to the sky, watching their potential next meal grapple with the high cable.

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: With reserved strength, Lynch shimmies across the cable a quickly as he can. Back at Parker's chair, she eyes the bending metal bolt t

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: is keeping her from plunging to the ground. Tears stream down her face again. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispered) Please god, don't let me fall. Don't let me fall. He stops once to catch his breath, but begins moving as quickly as possible. Finally, he reaches the second chair behind them and drop down into it. Looking at the lift pole from this position, he can clear see that it wasn't as close to the chair as it looked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's possible. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. Parker needs to yell to hear him now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PARKER

dialogues.speaker: WHAT
dialogues.text: LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He assesses the situation. It's going to take a big leap to try and get near the lad and he is winded beyond belief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PARKER

dialogues.speaker: WHAT'S WRONG
dialogues.text: LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: NOTHING. I'M GONNA GO FOR IT, OK
dialogues.text: M PARKER
LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) OK.

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: The two stare at each other from the distance.   Both of weather beaten faces are a mess. Parker is buried in the corner of the chair closest to th ground, holding on to the back of it to keep herself stea

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: Stoically, Lynch turns away from her and takes a deep bre He climbs up onto the chair back and looks down. Parker closes her eyes and prays. The wolves below do not break their stare.   Their hungry are willing Lynch to fall from the chair. It's now or never. LYNCH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yaaaaugh! He throws himself off of the chair and towards the ladder

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lands and hooks his arm around a rung. With a SNAP his arm dislocates from it's socket, but he is hooked on to t ladder! LYNCH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rrrrugh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PARKER

dialogues.speaker: YOU DID IT
dialogues.text: With his bad arm dangling by his side, Lynch works his wa down the icy metal ladder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally he reaches the ground and his body falls with a T into the snow. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oooof! The wolves' ears are at attention.     They watch careful the safety of the bushes. One, the LEADER, takes a cautious single step forward and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: waits. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: LYNCH
dialogues.text: (then)

dialogues.speaker: ANSWER ME
dialogues.text: The wolf leader begins a dangerously slow and cautious wa

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: towards Lynch's body. One step at a time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the camera tracks away from the approaching wolf and towards Lynch...it is revealed that he is only winded. He feels his body for damage, wincing at what can only be broken rib or two. His right arm is twisted at an odd ang and by the look on Lynch's face, it must be either broken fractured in addition to being dislocated. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: PARKER.
dialogues.text: PARKER (O.C.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wolf surveys the situation and stops in his tracks. The other wolves watch from the bushes. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry.   Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynch gets himself to his feet. His body is in massive pa but his adrenaline is going strong enough for him to figh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: through it. He moves quickly back up to the area underneath the middl chair. The leader growls. Drool drips down from beneath it's hun mouth as it takes a step back.

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: PARKER (O.C.)

dialogues.speaker: NO
dialogues.text: LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: The wolf leader advances on Lynch. Lynch makes it to the ski pole just in time and brandishe defensively at the creature. LYNCH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on!     Try something, fucker! The wolf stares back at him, growling.      Their eyes ar locked. Lynch swings the pole at it angrily. LYNCH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The leader shies away but growls harder. LYNCH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A second wolf rushes Lynch from behind and grabs his inju arm by the jacket and pulls back and forth. LYNCH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rest of the wolves quickly reveal themselves in the bushes and slowly saunter up towards the impending kill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker looks from Lynch to the ground way below her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PARKER (crying)

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: Lynch tries to fight off the wolf with his free arm. Finally, he is able to plunge the ski pole deep into the wolf's body.

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: The wolf SHRIEKS in pain and scampers away towards the sa of the pack. The impending wolves, stop their slow march and wait.   T food still has some fight left in it. LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: ME
dialogues.text: He moves as fast as he can towards the area under Parker' chair, swinging his weapon like a madman all the while. The wolves only stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, he reaches the area and grabs Dan's snowboard, s sticking up in the snow. LYNCH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker, I'm gonna go get help! Don't move and I'll be back as fast as I can!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker sobs. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just don't move!     I'm getting help! Without hesitation, Lynch throws down Dan's board and lay

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: his body on top of it. Pushing off he begins to slide quickly down the hill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From Parker's POV, she watches him disappear down the hil But mere seconds later, the pack of wolves gives chase an follow suit behind him over the horizon. Only the creaking of the strained metal chair arm can be

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: heard now. Parker sobs quietly to herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From a distance, Parker's broken chair dangles dangerousl the night air. Her body is slumped in the corner. Still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker is not moving in her chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The morning sun hits Parker's pale face.   Is she dead? Parker opens her eyes. She must have drifted off for the night. She looks to the tree-line around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun is coming up. She tries to move her body to look back in Lynch's direct and the chair argues back at her with another loud groan cable noise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PARKER (to herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynch. There is no sign of anyone or anything in the direction d the hill behind her. Slowly a look of great determination comes over her face.

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: She raises the safety bar. There is no more time to think.

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: She is going to die one way or another. Slowly, Parker turns her body around towards the seat of chair. Holding on to the metal beams that make up the chair, she beings to lower herself, inch by inch, off of the side. CREEEEE-EEK! The lone metal bolt protests the movement an makes metallic threats to snap. Parker keeps lowering herself until her entire lower body dangling below the chair. RRRRRUUUUUURRR! A gust of wind pushes against the chair, straining the arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker concentrates and slowly tries to hold up her weigh she inches her body even lower. Smoothly, slowly, almost there- SNAP!   The bolt gives wa The chair lurches down at an even greater angle, sending Parker off of the side!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PARKER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: AHHHH
dialogues.text: WHIRRR! WAP! No longer attached with the safety bolts, th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: chair falls several feet and then stops. It is now hangin only by the one weak thread of cabling that was used to initially wire it to the main line. Parker's hands catch at the base of the chair, and she is

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: dangling fully beneath it. While it is still a long drop...her feet are now a good 1 feet closer to the ground, if not more. CREEEEEK! The metal wire will not hold for more than a fe M

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: seconds. The chair is going to fall! Parker closes her eyes. All sound cuts out except for her quick breathing and her heartbeat. The camera shows us how much the last flimsy wire does no

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: like this movement as it stretches and the chair sways in wind. Slowly she looks down and prepares herself to fall.

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: The camera inches closer in to her face from below. Her heartbeat and breathing are all we hear until finally She let's go. As her body falls from the chair, the flimsy wire finally gives way and the rickety metal seat plummets straight do to the ground after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THUD! Parker lands hard and sound instantly returns to he She rolls to the side as the chair crashes down in her ve spot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is in tremendous pain but feels the solid ground bene her like a sailor who has found land for the first time i years. Surveying the damage- her ankle is badly broken underneat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the side of the chair that landed on it. Her boot is at a unnatural angle. Adrenaline overtakes her pain as she lifts the chair up a removes her foot from beneath it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks around for her snow board, but with all of the fresh snowfall it is buried and gone. Parker lays her body down flat on her jacket and begins t push herself down the mountainside as quickly as she can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker comes down the hill, gaining some speed on her awk coat/sled.

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: As she makes her way she spots a tree... with bright red blood splayed out in the snow around it. Cautiously she slows herself down.

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: PARKER (meekly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe...? From Parker's POV, the camera slowly reveals what is just beyond the bloody tree... But the look on Parker's face tells us everything we need know first. There, in the brush on the side of the trail beyond the t is the pack of wolves. Some still feeding.   Others resting attentively. They are circled around Lynch's bloody, half-eaten remain

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quick shots of his jacket, his boots, and his gloved hand flash before Parker's devastated eyes. She slows herself to a complete stop now.   Not knowing w to do. One of the feeding wolves hears this and looks back to se Parker just a few feet away. It is the pack leader. Lynch's blood pools from it's jaws. It's ears go back and it growls loudly at Parker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She makes eye contact with the beast, who stares back at almost daring her to try and take it's treasure. Others from the pack look up, distracted briefly, but the back to feeding. Parker and the pack leader lock eyes. Finally, the leader turns away from Parker, back to his f Back to his family. Though her face is emotionless, Parker's eyes are swollen with tears as she continues on her way down the mountain side. She is free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker continues down the treacherous trail as the snow f around her. Occasionally she hits bumps and turns that cause her to s from her awkward coat/sled...but she pulls herself back o and continues to make her way down the hill stoically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker reaches the bottom of the hill. Grunting and crying from the pain, she crawls over on her belly and begins to drag herself towards the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker drags her devastated body into the street. Just as she gets there....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEEP! A HONKING CAR races past with it's windshield wiper blaring. Narrowly missing being splattered, she collapses in the d road. There are no more cars to be seen. She is alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All that she can do is clutch the ground. And then... Another car approaches in the distance. She holds her hand up weakly. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please.   Stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DRIVER (male, 50's) is cautiously driving down the wet road. He reaches down to adjust the radio. He looks back up to reveal Parker's body in the road in f of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He swerves with a loud SKID! Partially off the road in a skid, his car comes to a stop Instantly he jumps out and runs to the body on the road. DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!   Are you OK?!   Hello! Parker is not moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He runs over to her side. DRIVER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lady.   Are you alright? Parker looks up at him and starts to cry with relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DRIVER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on, hold on- we're gonna get you help... He lifts her up into his arms and races her back to his c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver drives frantically, speaking into his cell pho DRIVER (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I found her laying in the road alone. Looks like she was in some sort of accident. Right outside of Mount Holliston. I'm taking her to you now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the passenger side window we see Parker's blank f If we didn't know better, we'd think she was a rotten cad at this point. Reflected in the glass are the lights of a PAPA GINO'S restaurant store front that goes past. Her eyes blink at the sign. DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on, Ma'am. The hospital is 10 minutes away. You're gonna be OK. The camera is tighter on her eyes. DRIVER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna be OK. Tight on just one eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DRIVER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (now in Dan's voice) You're gonna be OK, baby. Her eye closes.
